section.title: Pin Nodes
section.para: The Pin Nodes Toolbox is used to pin &skel; &nodes; so that they won't be moved by subsequent &skel; modification operations. Tools for pinning &nodes; are also found in the Pin Nodes Task Page. The tools in this Toolbox rely on mouse input, unlike the tools on the task page. The Toolbox operations always refer to the &skel; in the topmost &skel; &layer; in the Canvas.

illustrates the Pin Nodes Toolbox. The two sets of boxes labelled Mouse and Node show the coordinates (in physical units) of the mouse and of the &node; that's closest to the mouse. These boxes are continuously updated as the mouse moves. Below the Node boxes is an indicator of whether or not the nearest &node; is pinned or not.

caption.para: The Pin Nodes Toolbox and a Canvas displaying some pinned &nodes;. (The dots on the &nodes; have been enlarged for illustrative purposes.)

section.para:
The note at the top of the Toolbox explains how to use it: click on a &node; to pin it, shift-click on the &node; to unpin it, and control-click the &node; to toggle it. The buttons at the bottom of the Toolbox perform mouse-independent actions that duplicate features of the Pin Nodes Task Page, but are provided here for convenience:
The Undo and Redo buttons undo and redo the latest pinning operations.
The UnPinAll button unpins all the &nodes;.
The Invert button pins all of the unpinned &nodes; and unpins all of the pinned ones.

Pinned &nodes; are displayed on the Canvas with a small yellow dot. The size and color of the dot may be changed by enabling List All Layers in the Settings menu, and then editing the &layer;. The predefined &layer; displays the pinned &nodes; in the topmost &skel;.
